main.name: Anushka Kulshreshtha
main.description: I talk to people and computers
main.bio: I'm a tropical import to the midwest, having spent my life previously in India and Oman, and now in the cornfields as a Computer Science student at Grinnell College.
main.interest: When not negotiating time-zones, I like to explore the intersection of technology and society. When not doing that either, I like to small talk, play pretend as an actor, show my Bhangra, Swing or Contra moves and blare my British-Asian bangers from my window (previously, on my radio show).
main.jobsearch: As of this year, I'm also looking for full-time positions starting after my graduation in May 2021. So if you know of a Product Management, Developer, Designer position, or anything else I might find interesting, definitely hit that contact tab and let me know! (pretty plz.)

education.degree: Bachelors of Arts in Computer Science
education.coursework: With additional coursework in Math, English, Theater, Linguistics, Art, Sociology and Anthropology.
education.involvement: Activities: Theater, Contra and Swing Society, trying not to freeze in Iowa winters, Board games club, KPop dance group,

work.title: Events Liaison
work.description: Organized innovation and leadership events and created mentorship opportunities for the Grinnell community though relationships with Grinnell Alums and community partners

work.title: Student Researcher
work.description: Revamped a 2014 project, Mathematical Image Synthesis Toolkit (MIST) over 10 weeks by deciphering legacy code for image rendering, rewriting UI in React, Konva and Bootstrap, and recreating backend database using Express and MongoDB

work.company: Task Force and Belonging and Inclusion, SGA Grinnell
work.title: Researcher
work.description: Designed a qualitative study to identify what affects student retention and belonging at Grinnell. The rollout was put on indefinite hiatus due to COVID-19 pandemic

work.title: Visiting Student Intern
work.description: Created projects like online database scraping, translation and coding feature entry for Hindi in Grambank database, to better understand the organisation

work.company: Rootstalk Journal, The Center of Prairie Studies
work.title: Associate Editor
work.description: Put together a photo-essay on "Little Mogadishu" area of Minneapolis, in collaboration with a local photographer, and designed a study of the journal's readership.

work.title: Wellness peer educator
work.description: Devised and carried out programming on sexual respect and self governance for Grinnell students, managing design, collaboration and outreach

work.company: Alternate Language Study Option, Hindi I and II
work.title: Designer and Instructor
work.description: Designed and taught Hindi coursework to beginners for about 6 hr/wk

resume.interests: British Asian Music, Acting, Board games, Pride and Prejudice, social dancing (Contra, Swing, Bhangra), Diaspora Stories about building a new home, Transport for London

projects.title: Canadian Wanderlust
projects.category: My Travel Blog for my post-university travels

projects.title: Fury Fighting Gear
projects.category: (offline now) A fighting gear company I started

projects.title: Original Thai Food

projects.title: Resume Website
